section.para: This is the place where reports are build, and run. There are two ways to build a report using a WYSIWYG editor or source editor for .jrxml file, the last one is for advanced users. In preview we can see our report filled with data from datasource and save the results in different formats.

section.title: Design mode WYSIWYG editor.
section.para:
Most used editor, in Jaspersoft Studio. This editor is used together with Outline View , Properties View , Palette and Problems View
. Some complex JasperReports components like List, Table, Crosstab have their own editor, to open it just double click on the element in the designer or outline view. There are some buttons on the toolbar to control zoom, publish reports to a Jaspersoft Server, open query editor or change settings related to rulers, grid, decorators. To add elements to the page drag and drop them from the palette or it's possible to drag and drop Fields, Properties or Variables from outline view directly to the report. Use context menu to delete, arrange, resize, align, set PDF properties of the elements. It's possible to use keyboard to manipulate elements on the canvas: DEL to delete an element, arrows to select elements, . (point) will select an operation like resize left, right, up, down, or move.

section.title: Source mode.
section.para: This is a simple text editor with xml syntax highlighting. We can use it in combination with Outline view where all xml nodes are visible and clicking on a node will show position to the corresponding line in text editor.

Jrxml errors are shown in the left vertical band of the editor in front of the problematic line, users can see all the errors in Problems view, clicking on an error will position the cursor to the error line in the editor.

section.title: Preview mode.
section.para: The goal of this view is to for prompt user input parameters, help configure some settings, select a DataAdapter, see generated report in different formats, save report to a file. There are three main parts to do that:

Jrxml errors are shown in the left vertical band of the editor in front of the problematic line, users can see all the errors in Problems view, clicking on an error will position the cursor to the error line in the editor.

listitem.para: toolbar with buttons to select DataAdapter, run report button and a menu to select the preview mode like java, html, csv, etc.
on the right we have a preview for each format, for html this will be an embedded browser, for Java we'll have some additional controls like page navigation, zoom.
The right part, contains several pages: input controls, biult-in controls, sort fields, exporter preferences
